page.title: 02Geologists Paradise
page.content: Most of our area is unclassed serpent- inite with narrow bands of mica schist , gneiss with calcsilicate bands and siliceous and quartzo-feldspathic flags, as well as limestone which lie to the west of the thrust line which runs North and South near the western boundary of the area.Such a variety of minerals are to be found in Unst that it has been called a "geologist's paradise", but they are rarely found in quanities sufficient for commercial exploitation.However early in this century chromite was mined and shipped south from the pier at Baltasound till the shipping slump of the early twenties.The chromite quarries at Hagdale are on the Eastern border of this area.From this same pier talc has been shipped out from World War II until now from a quarry North of this area. It is shipped from the pier.
